pageContext.description: Late Bronze Age copper alloy palstave, 143mm long, 43mm wide and 29mm thick. The object is in fair condition with a green patina and weighs 324 grams. The Palstave is complete, the shaft end, which is 26mm wide, has a recess taking up just under half of its length (61mm). It has a complete curved blade, 43mm wide. It has a wide central rib which tapers, running the length of the blade and has one semi-circular loop. The object was found on the edge of the Humber estuary and has sustained water damage.
pageContext.notes: Identification report 009 completed 29/03/90 at Hull Museum.
pageContext.gridSource: Centred on village (which isn't a parish)
